title: 2019 Ford GT ’68 Heritage Edition
description: This 2019 Ford GT is one of 50 ’68 Heritage Edition examples built to commemorate the GT40 Mk I race car that was victorious at the 1968 24 Hours of Le Mans. The car has 3,127 miles and is finished in Heritage Blue with Competition Orange stripes over a black ’68 Heritage interior. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. The $20k Heritage Roundel Graphics package was selected, and additional equipment includes 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, a titanium exhaust, six-point harness anchors, a Heritage steering wheel, and carbon-fiber exterior trim. This Ford GT was purchased new through Sarasota Ford and is now offered by the estate of the original owner with a window sticker, manufacturer's literature, build documents, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the name of the late owner's surviving spouse.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2019 Ford GT ’68 Heritage Edition at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #199,052.
text: This 2019 Ford GT is one of 50 ’68 Heritage Edition examples built to commemorate the GT40 Mk I race car that was victorious at the 1968 24 Hours of Le Mans. The car has 3,127 miles and is finished in Heritage Blue with Competition Orange stripes over a black ’68 Heritage interior. Power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. The $20k Heritage Roundel Graphics package was selected, and additional equipment includes 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, a titanium exhaust, six-point harness anchors, a Heritage steering wheel, and carbon-fiber exterior trim. This Ford GT was purchased new through Sarasota Ford and is now offered by the estate of the original owner with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, build documents, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the name of the late owner’s surviving spouse. First unveiled at the 2015 North American International Auto Show, the second-generation GT was built by Multimatic of Markham, Ontario, with production beginning in December 2016. This example is finished Heritage Blue with Competition Orange stripes and Heritage Roundel Graphics. Additional features include LED headlights, a lightweight Gorilla Glass windshield, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, LED taillights, a rear diffuser, and carbon-fiber exterior trim. The GT features a carbon-fiber monocoque structure bolted to front and rear aluminum subframes that serve as stressed members for the hydraulically adjustable pushrod suspension system. Variable ride height, front-axle lift system, selectable driving modes, and launch control are standard features. Staggered-width 20″ forged aluminum wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires measuring 245/35 up front and 325/30 at the rear. Braking is handled by orange-painted Brembo six-piston monoblock calipers over 15.5” carbon-ceramic discs up front, while four-piston calipers are mounted over 14.1” units out back. The interior is optioned with the ’68 Heritage package, and the Sparco seats are trimmed in black leather and Alcantara upholstery with patterned seat inserts and Gulf-inspired blue and orange stitching. Exposed carbon fiber is visible on the door sills, dashboard, and center console, and the fixed-position driver’s seat is equipped with an adjustable pedal box and steering column. Additional appointments include climate control, an infotainment system with a touchscreen, and six-point harness anchors. The Alcantara-wrapped ’68 Heritage multi-function steering wheel fronts paddle shifters and a configurable digital instrument panel. The digital odometer indicates 3,127 miles. The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 3.5L EcoBoost V6 features a carbon-fiber engine cover and was factory rated at 647 horsepower and 550 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. The car is equipped with a titanium exhaust system, and carbon-fiber aero panels are fitted on the underside. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Sarasota Ford, and lists factory options, equipment, and a total price of $631,495. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
